story.text: (Adds details)Jan 2 (Reuters) - Lehman Brothers shifted its portfolio strategy, raising U.S. equity markets to "neutral" from "underweight" and cutting its exposure to Continental European stocks to "neutral". It moved to an "underweight" position in the UK and remained "overweight" in Japan. The brokerage said it was neutralising regional exposure as it positioned for a cyclical slowdown. Lehman said in an environment of slowing earnings growth, it believes the market will favour sectors in which there is scope for multiple expansion, the ability to releverage, or those with secular growth opportunities. Lehman said it was "overweight" in technology, media, telecoms, healthcare, insurance and energy but "underweight" in capital goods, basic industries, consumer cyclicals, utilities and consumer staples. The brokerage said it retained its positive stance towards global equity markets and anticipate a U.S. dollar based total return of 15 percent in 2007. (Reporting by Swagata Gupta in Bangalore)
story.title: update 1 - research alert - lehman ups u . s . equity markets
